page.title: 12BROMYARD FIRE SERVICE
page.content: By 1940, the{Bromyard Fire Service was fully equipped and very efficient. In 1941, the Brigade was taken over by the Government and travelled all over the country helping war_torn cities. The Bromyard Brigade was rated second in the county in 1942. The service covers an area between {Upper Sapey}and{Whitbourne.}There are only two full_time firemen at the station in{New Road}which was opened in 1961 at cost of{Â£7,500}after the old Newbold premises had almost collapsed. The station is fully equipped to deal with all fire_related emergencies. Water has been carried when the local supply has failed. Among other unusual duties tackled in this rural community, cows have been rescued from ponds.
